docs.title: Create
docs.text:
To create a BlueGrid project you need to click "Create" button, select to the directory where the project will reside, set the project name and finally hit save.

Create a project

docs.title: Import export pdf
docs.text:
In BlueGrid users can import pdf files, append pdf pages to a pdf file, delete pdf pages or export pdf pages with quantity remarks.

via GIPHY

Image caption

docs.title: Import
docs.text:
To import pdf files, follow steps below:

  1. Go to the Documents view,
  2. From the file menu select the menu "Import pdf files",
  3. Navigate the pdf files and click Open.
Import pdf files

docs.title: Material
docs.text:
In BlueGrid users can define materials with code, description, type and styles. A material must be one of 4 types: Count, Linear, Area, and Volume.

  1. Add a material

via GIPHY

Image caption
  1. Edit a material

via GIPHY

Image caption
  1. Remove a material

via GIPHY

Image caption

docs.title: Open
docs.text:
To open a project users have 2 options:

  1. Click "Open" button in the welcome window and navigate to the project file. This option is helpful when the project is not listed in the project list.
  2. If the project is listed in the project list, double click to project item in the list.
Open a project

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Write an overview of what BlueGrid standard edition can do, with support of grid images of functionalities.

docs.title: Remove PDF pages
docs.text:
This instruction will show you how to remove PDF pages, from a pdf file in Documents view. This action will delete all data related to the pages such as markup, quantity take-off, material, etc. This action cannot be undone.

  1. Go to the Documents view,
  2. On the pages view, select pages you want to remove,
  3. Go to page menu, select the menu "Remove pages".
Remove pdf page

docs.title: Remove PDF files
docs.text:
This instruction will show you how to remove PDF files from the Documents view. This action will remove all data associated with the deleted PDF files, including quantity measurements, material, markups, etc. This action cannot be undone.

  1. Go to the Documents view.
  2. From the file list, select the files that you want to delete.
  3. Go to the File menu and select the option "Remove PDF files".
Remove pdf files

docs.title: Set scale
docs.text:
To set scale for a pdf page users have 2 options:

1. Set scale directly from pdf grid view:
